soft_delete.description: All resource tables use soft delete pattern
soft_delete.rule: Always include 'deletedAt IS NULL' filter to exclude deleted records

excluded_select_columns.description: Internal system columns that should not appear in SELECT output
excluded_select_columns.rule: Do NOT include these columns in SELECT statements unless the user explicitly requests them by name. Note: Not all tables have all these columns - only filter those that exist. These columns may still be used in WHERE, ORDER BY, or JOIN clauses.

sysId.usage: Used for internal references and joins within the system

objectId.description: External resource identifier from cloud provider
rules: For tables prefixed with 'aws_': Contains Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
For tables prefixed with 'azure_': Contains Azure Resource ID
objectId.usage: Used to identify and reference actual cloud resources. Format varies by cloud provider.

createdAt.usage: When the record was first inserted into the database

updatedAt.usage: When the record was last updated

deletedAt.usage: NULL means active record, non-NULL means deleted. Always filter 'deletedAt IS NULL' for active records.

sql_conventions: Use double quotes for column and table names (PostgreSQL standard)
Use table aliases for clarity in JOINs
Include LIMIT clause to prevent large result sets

key_value_search.description: Case-insensitive search for key_value table columns
key_value_search.rule: When searching the key_value table's 'key' and 'value' columns, use case-insensitive comparison by default. Use LOWER() function or ILIKE operator. Only use exact case-sensitive matching if the user explicitly requests case-sensitive search.
